Hippocampus proper of RHA11.EditorialNote: The Rat Hippocampal Atlas does not show the hippocampus proper in its hierarchy;  however, in the text, they do state that "The Cornu Ammonis or Ammon's Horn (CA) also referred to as hippocampus proper, is characterized by a thin layer of densely packed pyramidal cells, enclosed by an outer plexiform layer and an inner polymorph layer, also called stratum oriens."  Therefore, I am using it to group the 3 CA fields together.
Hippocampus proper of RHA11.Definition: Superparcellation comprising the CA fields of the hippocampus.
